group_1.narration: Felicia cheered up a lot, thanks to@Momoko finishing off every last bite of the@New Year's meal that Mitama had cooked!

group_1.textRight: If anyone's poundin' mochi, it's gonna@be me!
Sana, make sure to keep up with me, ya got@it?!

group_1.textLeft: Uh, okay!
I'll leave it in your capable hands, Felicia!
Get that mochi nice and gooey!

group_1.textRight: Right!
Here I come!

[flashEffect:flashWhite2][bgEffect:shakeSmall][se:6053_hit_strike_03_s]Bam bam bam bam bam bam bam!@[chara:100501:lipSynch_0][wait:0.5][chara:100501:motion_200][flashEffect:flashWhite2][bgEffect:shakeSmall][se:6053_hit_strike_03_s][chara:100501:lipSynch_1]Wham wham wham wham wham wham!

group_1.textLeft: Eeeeeek!

group_1.textRight: I wanna do it too! Lemme do it!

group_1.textCenter: *Sigh* Looks like they've taken over the @mochi pounding.

group_1.textLeft: Maybe I'll have a go, too.

group_1.textRight: Huh?! But you never want to do anything,@Rena!

group_1.textLeft: I mean it's childish, so I don't really want @to do it, but...
Seeing as it's New Year's I figure it@couldn't hurt.
[chara:100901:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Why's the mallet so heavy?! Wait, it's the@mochi! This mochi weighs a ton!
Oh, my! That can't be right.

group_1.textRight: Are you responsible for this, Mitama?

group_1.textLeft: Of course not!

group_1.textRight: Really? You didn't add anything to the rice?

group_1.textLeft: Really! All I did was choose the brand.@"World's Stickiest".

group_1.textRight: That has to be it...

group_1.textLeft: No, it can't just be that!
Felicia and Ayame's super fast attacks@must've caused a chemical reaction.
So now it's even stickier!

group_1.textRight: [chara:302801:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]Wow, wow! I'm awesome!

group_1.textLeft: Hey! I'm WAY more awesome than you are!

group_1.textRight: Then...the more we pound the rice, the@stronger it'll stick to the mallet?
We should probably stop pounding it...

group_1.textLeft: True. I wonder what we can do with it@instead?

group_1.textRight: That's an easy question.

group_1.textLeft: Oh?

group_1.textRight: Let's come up with our own ways to eat it.

group_1.narration: Mitama was nice enough to go@along with Yachiyo's suggestion.
So we started looking up all sorts of@recipes that use mochi and tried using@the food everyone brought in our own way.

group_1.textRight: I toasted it!
If you cook it until it's brown, it gives@a nice crunch that goes with anything.

group_1.textLeft: I decided to make pancakes with mochi@in them.
You don't need pancake mix to make pancakes?@Huh.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, why don't you try making some, too?

group_1.textLeft: Ugh, major pain. No thanks!
...But if you're making them, I suppose@I'll have one or two.

group_1.textRight: It's always the same with you.
Um...I was thinking... I might try making@rice crackers using mochi...

group_1.textLeft: Oooh, awesome! Give it a shot!
Let's see, first thing you gotta do is...
Hey, Hazuki. What do you think about@cheese and ham on mochi...
...and toasting the whole thing?

group_1.textRight: Well, I don't see why not? It's like pizza,@so it sounds pretty good to me.

group_1.textCenter: Did you say pizza?! I looove pizza!

group_1.textRight: Seeing all this toasted mochi...
I kind of want some soup...

group_1.textLeft: Ya know, I kinda like soft, boiled mochi@better.
*Giggle* I thought someone would say so.@I have some ready if you like?

group_1.textRight: Uh?
Er...
Oh no!
